name: bootstralph-v2
description: Stack scaffolding + skills sync + pre-commit hooks. Delegates planning/execution to Ralph TUI.

userStories.title: Setup project with bun, TypeScript, and tsup
userStories.description: As a developer, I need the project initialized with bun, TypeScript, and tsup so that I can build the CLI.
acceptanceCriteria: package.json created with name 'bootstralph', type 'module', bin entry pointing to dist/index.js
Dependencies installed: @clack/prompts, commander, execa, handlebars, fast-glob, zod
tsconfig.json configured for ES2022, bundler moduleResolution, strict mode
tsup.config.ts configured for ESM output, src/index.ts entry

userStories.title: Create CLI entry point with commander
userStories.description: As a developer, I need a CLI entry point using commander so that users can run bootstralph commands.
acceptanceCriteria: commander program configured with name, version, description
Placeholder commands added: create, init, sync, detect

userStories.title: Create logger utilities with @clack/prompts
userStories.description: As a developer, I need logger utilities wrapping @clack/prompts so that CLI output is consistent and user-friendly.
acceptanceCriteria: Exports: intro, outro, spin, log (info, success, warn, error), confirm, select, multiselect

userStories.title: Create exec utilities with execa wrapper
userStories.description: As a developer, I need exec utilities wrapping execa so that I can run shell commands consistently.
acceptanceCriteria: Exports: exec function that wraps execa with sensible defaults

userStories.title: Create file utilities
userStories.description: As a developer, I need file utilities so that I can read/write JSON, check file existence, and work with paths.
acceptanceCriteria: Exports: readJson, writeJson, exists, ensureDir, readFile, writeFile
All functions properly typed with generics where appropriate

userStories.title: Create package scanner for detection
userStories.description: As a developer, I need a package scanner that reads package.json to extract dependencies for stack detection.
acceptanceCriteria: Returns: { dependencies: string[], devDependencies: string[], scripts: Record<string, string> }

userStories.title: Create config scanner for detection
userStories.description: As a developer, I need a config scanner that finds configuration files to help detect the stack.
acceptanceCriteria: Uses fast-glob to find config files (next.config.*, app.json, drizzle.config.*, etc.)
Returns array of found config file paths
CONFIG_PATTERNS constant exported with framework/feature mappings

userStories.title: Create stack inferrer for detection
userStories.description: As a developer, I need a stack inferrer that combines package and config signals to determine the framework and features.
acceptanceCriteria: Takes package scan + config scan results as input
Returns DetectedStack type with framework, features, confidence score
Correctly identifies: nextjs, expo, tanstack-start, astro, hono, elysia
Correctly identifies features: auth type, database, styling, testing

userStories.title: Create detection module entry point
userStories.description: As a developer, I need a detection entry point that orchestrates the full stack detection flow.
acceptanceCriteria: Orchestrates: package scan -> config scan -> inference
Also exports detectedToConfig helper to convert DetectedStack to StackConfig

userStories.title: Implement detect command
userStories.description: As a user, I want to run 'bootstralph detect' to see what stack was detected in the current project.
acceptanceCriteria: Exports detect function that takes options
Runs detectStack and prints results using logger utilities
Shows: framework, features, confidence score, detected packages

userStories.title: Create skill mappings data file
userStories.description: As a developer, I need a skill mappings data file that maps packages/configs to OpenSkills skills.
acceptanceCriteria: Includes mappings for: react, nextjs, expo, tanstack, astro, hono
Includes mappings for: better-auth, clerk, supabase, drizzle, prisma
Includes mappings for: tailwind, vitest, jest, playwright
Includes mappings for: vercel, cloudflare, turborepo

userStories.title: Create mappings loader for skills
userStories.description: As a developer, I need a mappings loader that reads and parses the skill mappings data.
acceptanceCriteria: Exports: loadMappings function that returns SkillMapping[]
Exports: computeRequiredSkills function that takes deps + configFiles and returns required skills
Handles both packages and configFiles triggers

userStories.title: Create manifest CRUD for skills
userStories.description: As a developer, I need manifest CRUD operations to track which skills are installed and why.
acceptanceCriteria: SkillsManifest type: version, updatedAt, skills record
Creates default manifest if none exists

userStories.title: Create diff computation for skills
userStories.description: As a developer, I need diff computation to determine which skills to install or remove.
acceptanceCriteria: Takes current manifest + required skills as input
Returns SkillsDiff with toInstall and toRemove arrays
Handles orphaned skills (installed for packages that no longer exist)

userStories.title: Create OpenSkills CLI wrapper
userStories.description: As a developer, I need an OpenSkills CLI wrapper to install/uninstall/list skills.
acceptanceCriteria: Exports: openskillsList() - runs 'npx openskills list' and parses output

userStories.title: Create skills sync entry point
userStories.description: As a developer, I need a skills sync entry point that orchestrates the full sync flow.
acceptanceCriteria: Exports: syncSkills function with quiet option
Flow: read package.json -> detect configs -> load manifest -> compute diff -> install/remove -> save manifest -> regenerate AGENTS.md

userStories.title: Implement sync command
userStories.description: As a user, I want to run 'bootstralph sync' to synchronize skills based on my package.json.

userStories.title: Create lefthook template
userStories.description: As a developer, I need a lefthook.yml Handlebars template that generates stack-appropriate hooks.
acceptanceCriteria: Template variables: packageManager, linting, formatting, hasTypeScript, hasTests
Conditionally includes: lockfile check, format, lint, typecheck, test
Comments indicate it was generated by bootstralph

userStories.title: Create lefthook generator
userStories.description: As a developer, I need a lefthook generator that renders the template with stack config.

userStories.title: Create ralph skill template

Documents key patterns for the detected stack

userStories.title: Create ralph skill generator

userStories.title: Implement create command
userStories.description: As a user, I want to run 'bootstralph create <name>' to scaffold a new project with the wizard.
acceptanceCriteria: Flow: intro -> runWizard -> scaffold -> chdir -> generateLefthook -> generateRalphSkill -> generateBootstralphConfig -> addPackageScripts -> lefthook install -> syncSkills -> outro
Accepts optional --preset flag for quick configs

userStories.title: Implement init command
userStories.description: As a user, I want to run 'bootstralph init' to set up bootstralph in an existing project.
acceptanceCriteria: Flow: intro -> detectStack -> (confirm or runWizard if low confidence) -> generateLefthook -> generateRalphSkill -> generateBootstralphConfig -> addPackageScripts(merge) -> lefthook install -> syncSkills -> outro
